page.title: 05Bentinck Colliery
page.content: At the Bentinck there is one square mile of surface pit.Underground it is five miles each way, and there are seventy miles of tunnels altogether. There are 930 workers underground and 1231 workers altogether. Bentinck brings up 300 tons of coal a day,45000 tons a month and 2 000 000 tons a year. The most coal brought up in a day was 7000 tons. Fifty coal lorries go out each day but most of the coal travels to power stations on trains. The pit is named after Cavendish Bentinck. It was built in 1895. It has been going 90 years. There are three shafts at the pit. They are nearly 600 feet deep. It is the second biggest pit in Britain. The onlymajor accident, in 1911, was a shaft accident when 11 men died.
